TomoDefiningCriteria: covered by opercular parts of frontal
ConnDefiningCriteria: Receives connections from sensory thalamic nuclei
CytoDefiningCriteria: the insula is divided into three cytoarchitectonic areas: (1) a rostroventral agranular ﬁeld that is divided into two architectonically distinct zones: the periallocortex surrounding the primary olfactory cortex
Insula.EditorialNote: I added the synonyms from Brain Info, but I'm still debating whether insular gyrus is a synonym for insular cortex.  I think so, but perhaps needs review.
Insula.Definition: Gray matter of the insular region of the neocortex. In gyrencephalic animals, it is part of the insular lobe and lies in the depths of the lateral fissure and covered by portions of the frontal, parietal and temporal lobes. It includes Brodmann areas 13-16.
